Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2011 03:22PM marticcrn wrote: We are both still waiting then.  As a nurse, I can tell you that I would NEVER share biopsy results, positive or negative with a patient - there's potentially too many other things that need to be discussed at the time and patients are often "lost to follow up" thereafter, either way.  So don't read too much into this.  The waiting is killing me too.  I just had lunch with a new BCO friend who lives near me and then I'm taking my puppy to the dog park.  Trying to stay occupied, glued to the phone.   Keep us updated, we're all in this together, Marti

Posts.Content: marticcrn wrote: Okay women, I've been waiting just a few days shy of two months and now my excisional biopsy path report should be in any day. I have been remarkably calm and in good spirits throughout a positive screening mammo, positive diagnostic mammo, positive ultrasound, and inconclusive core needle biopsy. I had an excisional biopsy Friday. Couldn't sleep Monday night. Had a couple of crying jags yesterday, blubbering about missing six years of screening mammos. Took an ambien last night. Now I'm just siting by the phone like a girl hoping someone will ask her to the prom. Oy. I can't stand the waiting any more. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: marticcrn wrote: So I had an excisional biopsy (B9) in March - fibroadenoma.  Now, I've noticed an itchy, very very painful spot (doesn't feel like a lump) on my same side areola.  Feels like an abscess, very painful, no discharge.  The slight swelling there (just for three days) has caused my nipple to invert just a tad.   No skin scaling or anything like that to indicate Paget's disease.  I'm watching it for now.  Anyone have anything like this before?  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2011 10:43AM marticcrn wrote: Sorry for such a terrible visit.  I'm a nurse and I know what cocky jacka$$es surgeons CAN be.  Many others are wonderful. caring human beings, and it sounds like you need to find one of those and sit down for a chat.  Is there a surgeon in your area who just does breast cancer surgery?  Or perhaps an oncologist you could review everything with?  More hoops, but it sounds like you are not comfortable with your answers and I understand why. Keep in touch. Marti

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 09:28PM marticcrn wrote: Just got back from my surgery appointment and I have mixed feelings about it.  The surgeon is not at all impressed with the pathology report - she states it's a fibroadenoma, even though the pathologist thought it was probably a fibroadenoma but wasn't sure and the radiologist said it didn't feel like a fibroadenoma when she biopsied it.  The surgeon's first sentence was, "They are recommending excision but you can refuse it."   Am I just being a baby?  She also says I can go back to work the next day.  Is this realistic? At any rate, I am thankful that though I don't have a diagnosis yet, I do not have a diagnosis of cancer either at this point.

Posts.Content: marticcrn wrote: Just found this site for physicians - Stanford University's Surgical Pathology Criteria for all reports on breast tissue - not just cancer.  Helped me understand my path report.  Hope it helps you with yours.  www.surgpathcriteria.stanford.edu/by_section.html#Breast   Blessings to you all.  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2011 11:30AM marticcrn wrote: I so hear you, sister.  I had screening mammo 1/11.  Diagnostic mammo, US and core biopsy 2/11, with inconclusive results - "no concordance" between the radiologists report and the pathologist's report. Radiologist said the lump looked like a benign fibroadenoma but didn't feel like one.  Pathologist did not find circumscription (part of criteria for fibroadenoma).  Surgeon at appointment told me "You can just refuse - it's just a benign fibroadenoma."  After surgery yesterday, she said we will "know what the hell that was" when we get pathology.  I am very tired of waiting for an answer too.  Coming up on two months now.   Are you having an excisional biopsy soon?  Keep us informed, we're all in this together.   Marti

Posts.Content: marticcrn wrote: So - positive screening mammo, diagnostic mammo and ultrasound and then core biopsy Tuesday. Got path report yesterday, states "favor fibroadenoma" but see comment.  Comment is lengthy and extremely technical (and I'm a nurse and know how to look stuff up) but seems to say it mostly looks like a fibroadenoma but there are some things that don't match.  And the radiologist said when she did the biopsy it didn't feel firm like a fibroadenoma feels.  So now I'm headed to a surgeon Thursday for a consult for a lumpectomy/excisional biopsy.   The waiting is terrible. The radiologist says I will have to have wires placed before surgery to locate the site correctly.   How long is it before I can go back to work?  Anyone know if they will do a sentinel lymph node on this type of lumpectomy?  Any thoughts on what is a good type of post-op bra?  Other practical hints for surgery? Anyone else dealing with this type of issue? Log in to post a reply
